reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good product
reviews.author: joni turner
reviews.content: The Togala Smartwatch offers a good mix of functionality and style. It features a phone function and message reminders, making it convenient to stay connected without constantly checking your phone. The watch is designed for both men and women, with a sleek, modern look that suits various outfits and occasions. It tracks health metrics like heart rate, steps, and sleep, making it a useful fitness companion. The user interface is straightforward, and the battery life is decent for daily use. Overall, it’s a solid option for those looking for an affordable, feature-packed smartwatch

reviews.content: This is my first smart-watch. I don't have anything to compare it with, but I am quite happy with the features, looks and feel of it. It has many features and everything seems to work great. For me health-related features were most important - heart rate, oxygen meter, and sleep pattern; also exercise and a pedometer are all great features to have.It also has many other features - a stopwatch, timer, alarm, message notifications, and music player; you can make a call (haven't figured out if I can receive calls on it yet). It pairs with your phone and you can see and control some features from the phone app too.Battery life is great - probably going to last 4-5 days on full charge with regular use.

reviews.title: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value, but not customizable enough
reviews.author: Andrew J. Holland
reviews.content: I wanted a simple Smart Watch. A dumb Smart Watch, if you will. Something that tells time and can be charged without the constant need for replacement watch batteries. With that goal in mind, this watch mostly delivers, though a few things need tweaking. All are firmware-related. Firstly, if you have the watch set to turn on when you raise it and it's working for you, congratulations, because mine doesn't. The software requires a widget (component) to the right of the main watch face screen. You have to pick at least one and it can't be deleted. Why? There was no airplane mode I could find. The settings are pretty limited. Being able to import your own image (companion app only) is a nice feature, but your custom faces aren't saved in the app. Not even one at a time. Zero. It sends the image to your watch via Bluetooth and that's it. I don't want or need the heart rate feature, but if you're setting your own background, you have to have the heart icon in the upper right corner. It can't be removed, even if you turn off the monitor in settings. On the plus side, the watch is comfortable and lightweight, and if you get it on sale as I did for 30 bucks, it's well worth that amount, but the settings need more features. The companion app as well is fairly barebones.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything about this watch!!!
reviews.author: Lifelover
reviews.content: Okay, first of all, I’ll start by saying that I’ve never own an Apple Watch (and I don’t think I need it). This watch has everything I’ve wanted! I’ve had 2 smartwatches in the past (few years) and this is by far my favorite! The size I guess is like a normal smart watch, charging speed is great, it looks exactly like an expensive smartwatch, it tracks my sleep (which that’s one of the reasons I chose it), it is SO easy to set up, you can make phone calls!!! The sound quality is great (for being a watch!), I did a whole call from there, the best part and crazy part that it was a zoom call, and my watch took over when my AirPods stopped working (I mention that because my phone doesn’t work for calls), what else? Text messages! You can read them through your phone (or calls) if you don’t have your phone near you, just answer the call through your watch :) I love it!
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 28, 2024

Calls sound great, no text replies, but can read all texts and notifications pushed from my phone. The touch screen display responds really well and the color is excellent and very sharp. The flexible strap is super comfy to wear and I don’t even need to take it off in the shower. I love being able to customize the watch face, just wish I could modify the ringtone. So much to love about this watch!

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Togala Smart Watches Is a Top Choice for Budget-Conscious Buyers
reviews.author: Emma
reviews.content: I recently picked up the Togala Smart Watches, and it’s been a pleasant surprise. Here are two main points that make this smartwatch stand out:Battery Life: The battery life on this smartwatch is impressive. I’ve been using it consistently for about a week, and it’s still going strong. It easily lasts through my daily activities and then some, so you won’t find yourself constantly hunting for the charger. For anyone tired of frequent recharges, this is a real game-changer.Value for Money: This smartwatch offers exceptional value at its price point. It packs in features typically found in more expensive models, including fitness tracking, notifications, and customizable watch faces, all without breaking the bank. It’s a fantastic option if you want to balance cost and functionality.Overall: The Togala Smart Watches delivers on all fronts—easy setup, long-lasting battery, and a price that won’t hurt your wallet. If you’re in the market for a smartwatch that covers the basics and more, this one is worth considering.

reviews.title: 3.0 out of 5 stars Just OK
reviews.author: Baruch
reviews.content: This watch promises more than it delivers. It purports to measure your pulse, but I find it seriously inaccurate. The values are all over the place, from 50 BPM to over 130 BPM. There is no way I could have been at 130 BPM without my knowing it - I'd have been gasping for breath. I doubt my pulse ever gets down to 50 BPM, either. I'm just not that laid back.The manufacturer says that for greater accuracy you need to wear the watch more tightly om your wrist. When I tried that I found that my skin couldn't breathe, which caused it to become irritated. So the values are just going to be inaccurate.It doesn't seem to know when I go to sleep, either. Often before I turn in, I read for a bit. At such times I am immobile, so the watch thinks I'm sleeping. If I have to get up to pee in the night, the watch thinks I've gotten up for 20-40 minutes or so.It purports to measure blood oxygen saturation levels, which for all I know it might be doing. I have never found any use for that particular function.It annoyingly is connected to my phone such that when I get a call, my watch starts making a lot of noise. I have not yet found the way to stop this. The instructions are inadequate. This is highly annoying, because almost every call is spam.One feature that seems to work well is its keeping track of my steps. That's useful, and is a reminder to me to keep walking. Once upon a time I had a pedometer that I used. That's all it did - measure my steps. I wanted that. So if this watch did nothing more, I would still like it as a pedometer.Overall I am disappointed in this watch. I probably wouldn't buy it again. I might recommend it to someone I didn't like.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States October 11, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best smart watch
reviews.author: Efthakar
reviews.content: Thus, I can say that the Togala Smart Watch has met and even crossed my expectations of a smartwatch with 1. Measuring 96 inches with full touchscreen technology the unit comes with a high quality touch screen that is very responsive and has very high resolution. Fitness tracking features are well rounded they include things like heart rate tracking and sleep tracking making it a good health companion. Due to the stylish appearance and good feeling on the wrist it can be utilized daily.,furthermore the navigation is very understandable. Notifications and alerts together with my phone, work in harmony making me connected while on the go. Battery life is satisfactory and you could be using it for several days on a go without having to recharge it.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States July 30, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Big display with everything at a glance
reviews.author: Carla Hall
reviews.content: Big display that I can see without my reading glasses. Tracking heart rate during physical activity is important to me as I need to monitor it. I hope it will encourage me to be more active by showing me on the face how many steps I've taken each day. This is my first smart watch and I'm still learning all the tricks it can do. I made a test phone call and that worked fine. Tracks my heart rate well.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 1, 2024

reviews.title: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smartwatch.
reviews.author: Kenneth Goins
reviews.content: I have used other versions of this smart watch and this is the best. It's so light to wear. I use it to track my fitness but it does so much more. Making my life easier. I would definitely recommend with 6 stars.
reviews.timestamp: Reviewed in the United States September 25, 2024
